p: The partial sill (C 1) was 0.2582, 7.7863, 0.6320, 0.9723, and 1.9801 in each wave, respectively. The nugget (C 0) was 0.4789, 0.1642, 0.0982, 0.1416 and 0.2161 in each corresponding wave, respectively. The C 1/ C 0+ C 1 ratios among the last four waves were all above 85%, and were even above 90% in the second and fifth waves, but was relatively low (35%) in the first wave, which suggested that the spatial autocorrelation was generally relatively strong. All the results are shown in Table 4.
